item.title: My Keyboard class
item.dc:creator: @k00dr k00dr
item.description:
@k00dr wrote:

public static final int VK_0
VK_0 thru VK_9 are the same as ASCII ‘0’ thru ‘9’ (0x30 - 0x39)

public static final int VK_A
VK_A thru VK_Z are the same as ASCII ‘A’ thru ‘Z’ (0x41 - 0x5A)


Understand or not.

Read full topic

Meh, it works. As far as I’m concerned, that’s all that matters.
[/quote] Whoa you are so wrong there… The rs client logs all events onto the applet and key release is one of them, im very sure they have a mechanism for detecting that kind of coding mistakes.

If you want people to use your code, you might as well make it usable.[/quote]
Well, that does pose a bit of a problem, doesn’t it?

item.title: My Keyboard class
item.dc:creator: @googlethis googlethis
item.description:
@googlethis wrote:

This is just to make it easy for anyone who might need something like this, as it is VERY tedious coding.

import java.util.*;
import java.awt.*;
import java.awt.event.*;

public class Keyboard{
	public static void sendKeys(String s){
		Robot r = null;
		try{
			r = new Robot();
		}catch(AWTException e){}
		for(char c : s.toCharArray()){
			r.keyPress(getKeyCode(c));
			r.keyRelease(KeyEvent.VK_SHIFT);
		}
	}
	public static char getKeyCode(char c){
		Robot r = null;
		try{
			r = new Robot();
		}catch(AWTException e){}
		switch (c){
			case 'a':
				return KeyEvent.VK_A;	
			case 'b':
				return KeyEvent.VK_B;
			case 'c':
				return KeyEvent.VK_C;
			case 'd':
				return KeyEvent.VK_D;	
			case 'e':
				return KeyEvent.VK_E;
			case 'f':
				return KeyEvent.VK_F;
			case 'g':
				return KeyEvent.VK_G;	
			case 'h':
				return KeyEvent.VK_H;
			case 'i':
				return KeyEvent.VK_I;			
			case 'j':
				return KeyEvent.VK_J;	
			case 'k':
				return KeyEvent.VK_K;
			case 'l':
				return KeyEvent.VK_L;
			case 'm':
				return KeyEvent.VK_M;	
			case 'n':
				return KeyEvent.VK_N;
			case 'o':
				return KeyEvent.VK_O;
			case 'p':
				return KeyEvent.VK_P;	
			case 'q':
				return KeyEvent.VK_Q;	
			case 'r':
				return KeyEvent.VK_R;
			case 's':
				return KeyEvent.VK_S;
			case 't':
				return KeyEvent.VK_T;	
			case 'u':
				return KeyEvent.VK_U;
			case 'v':
				return KeyEvent.VK_V;
			case 'w':
				return KeyEvent.VK_W;
			case 'x':
				return KeyEvent.VK_X;
			case 'y':
				return KeyEvent.VK_Y;
			case 'z':
				return KeyEvent.VK_Z;
			case 'A':
				r.keyPress(KeyEvent.VK_SHIFT);
				return KeyEvent.VK_A;
			case 'B':
				r.keyPress(KeyEvent.VK_SHIFT);
				return KeyEvent.VK_B;
			case 'C':
				r.keyPress(KeyEvent.VK_SHIFT);
				return KeyEvent.VK_C;
			case 'D':
				r.keyPress(KeyEvent.VK_SHIFT);
				return KeyEvent.VK_D;	
			case 'E':
				r.keyPress(KeyEvent.VK_SHIFT);
				return KeyEvent.VK_E;
			case 'F':
				r.keyPress(KeyEvent.VK_SHIFT);
				return KeyEvent.VK_F;
			case 'G':
				r.keyPress(KeyEvent.VK_SHIFT);
				return KeyEvent.VK_G;	
			case 'H':
				r.keyPress(KeyEvent.VK_SHIFT);
				return KeyEvent.VK_H;
			case 'I':
				r.keyPress(KeyEvent.VK_SHIFT);
				return KeyEvent.VK_I;			
			case 'J':
				r.keyPress(KeyEvent.VK_SHIFT);
				return KeyEvent.VK_J;	
			case 'K':
				r.keyPress(KeyEvent.VK_SHIFT);
				return KeyEvent.VK_K;
			case 'L':
				r.keyPress(KeyEvent.VK_SHIFT);
				return KeyEvent.VK_L;
			case 'M':
				r.keyPress(KeyEvent.VK_SHIFT);
				return KeyEvent.VK_M;	
			case 'N':
				r.keyPress(KeyEvent.VK_SHIFT);
				return KeyEvent.VK_N;
			case 'O':
				r.keyPress(KeyEvent.VK_SHIFT);
				return KeyEvent.VK_O;
			case 'P':
				r.keyPress(KeyEvent.VK_SHIFT);
				return KeyEvent.VK_P;	
			case 'Q':
				r.keyPress(KeyEvent.VK_SHIFT);
				return KeyEvent.VK_Q;	
			case 'R':
				r.keyPress(KeyEvent.VK_SHIFT);
				return KeyEvent.VK_R;
			case 'S':
				r.keyPress(KeyEvent.VK_SHIFT);
				return KeyEvent.VK_S;
			case 'T':
				r.keyPress(KeyEvent.VK_SHIFT);
				return KeyEvent.VK_T;	
			case 'U':
				r.keyPress(KeyEvent.VK_SHIFT);
				return KeyEvent.VK_U;
			case 'V':
				r.keyPress(KeyEvent.VK_SHIFT);
				return KeyEvent.VK_V;
			case 'W':
				r.keyPress(KeyEvent.VK_SHIFT);
				return KeyEvent.VK_W;
			case 'Y':
				r.keyPress(KeyEvent.VK_SHIFT);
				return KeyEvent.VK_Y;
			case 'Z':
				r.keyPress(KeyEvent.VK_SHIFT);
				return KeyEvent.VK_Z;
			case '1':
				return KeyEvent.VK_1;
			case '2':
				return KeyEvent.VK_2;
			case '3':
				return KeyEvent.VK_3;
			case '4':
				return KeyEvent.VK_4;
			case '5':
				return KeyEvent.VK_5;
			case '6':
				return KeyEvent.VK_6;
			case '7':
				return KeyEvent.VK_7;
			case '8':
				return KeyEvent.VK_8;
			case '9':
				return KeyEvent.VK_9;
			case '0':
				return KeyEvent.VK_0;
			case ';':
				return KeyEvent.VK_SEMICOLON;
			case ':':
				r.keyPress(KeyEvent.VK_SHIFT);
				return KeyEvent.VK_SEMICOLON;
			case '\'':
				return KeyEvent.VK_QUOTE;
			case '"':
				r.keyPress(KeyEvent.VK_SHIFT);
				return KeyEvent.VK_QUOTE;
			case '-':
				return KeyEvent.VK_SUBTRACT;
			case '_':
				r.keyPress(KeyEvent.VK_SHIFT);
				return KeyEvent.VK_SUBTRACT;
			default:
				return KeyEvent.VK_SPACE;
		}
	}
}

I only put in what I though useful, I would love it if someone told me that I forgot a often-used character.

Read full topic
